net.proteusframework.internet.support

Class LocaleUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.internet.support.LocaleUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class LocaleUtil
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Utilities for localization. Creating an instance of this class is intended to be light weight so that a reference can be held if necessary. The implementation may do some caching of object such as LocaleContext and is considered thread safe.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • copyLocalizedObjectKey

        public static net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocalizedObjectKey copyLocalizedObjectKey(Locale locale,
                                                                         net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocalizedObjectKey key)
        Copies the given LocalizedObjectKey value into a new key for the given locale. The use case is for creating a new key from static text for the given locale, usually to provide a default.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale.
        key - the key having the text to copy.
        Returns:
        LocalizedObjectKey.

      • copyLocalizedObjectKey

        public static net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocalizedObjectKey copyLocalizedObjectKey(net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocalizedObjectKey key)
        Copies the given LocalizedObjectKey values into a new key for all used locales. The use case is for copying a key that may have text values in multiple locales.
        Parameters:
        key - the key having the text to copy.
        Returns:
        LocalizedObjectKey.

      • getLocaleContext

        public static net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContext getLocaleContext(Locale locale)
        Get the locale context. This method can be called in situations in code that may be called within a Request/Response cycle and outside of a Request/Response cycle.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale.
        Returns:
        LocaleContext. This value shouldn't be stored, but instead call this method again to ensure the correct LocaleContext is obtained. This locale context could be immutable.

      • getLocaleContext

        public static net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContext getLocaleContext(@Nullable
                                                              net.proteusframework.users.model.Principal user,
                                                              Locale defLocale)
        Get a LocaleContext using the specified user's preferred locale.
        Parameters:
        user - optional user.
        defLocale - the default / fallback locale.
        Returns:
        the LocaleContext.

      • getLocalizedObjectKey

        public static net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocalizedObjectKey getLocalizedObjectKey(Locale locale,
                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                        net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocalizedObjectKey key,
                                                                        String text)
        Get a LocalizedObjectKey with the specified text. This is useful for updating a property that is a LocalizedObjectKey. This method calls LocalizedObjectKey.getLocalizedObjectKey(LocaleSource, Locale, LocalizedObjectKey, String) with the LocaleSource.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale.
        key - the existing key. May be null.
        text - the text to update.
        Returns:
        the key.
        See Also:
        LocalizedObjectKey.getLocalizedObjectKey(LocaleSource, Locale, LocalizedObjectKey, String)

      • hasLocalization

        public static boolean hasLocalization(@Nullable
                      net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocalizedObjectKey localizedObjectKey)
        Return true if the specified LocalizedObjectKey has at least a single localization with content.
        Parameters:
        localizedObjectKey - the key. May be null.
        Returns:
        true or false.
        See Also:
        LocalizedObjectKey.hasLocalization(LocaleSource)
